reviews.review: Mesmo sendo um jogo lan√ßado h√° 16 anos, continua sendo um jogo lindo em qualquer aspecto, os gr√°ficos s√£o belos at√© mesmo hoje em dia, apesar de ter fases melhores que as outras, em geral o jogo se mant√©m constantemente no mesmo n√≠vel de qualidade, enredo muito bom mas voc√™ pode acabar n√£o desfrutando 100% de tudo se n√£o jogou o primeiro Half-Life, jogabilidade muito boa, as miss√µes se passam em um 'pacing' agrad√°vel na maioria das vezes, com enigmas, momentos de descanso e explora√ß√£o para n√£o se tornar um caos de tiros e bombas fren√©tico, ele tem alguns bugs (em especial um bug de ilumina√ß√£o que aconteceu comigo) mas que podem ser facilmente resolvidos buscando no Google, vale total a pena dar uma chance para ele, se voc√™ n√£o sabe ingl√™s, n√£o se preocupe que h√° uma em PT-PT, basta procurar no Google tamb√©m. Enfim, compre, vale totalmente a pena.

Half-Life 2 is honestly one of the best games I have ever played. The story is great, the characters are great, the environments are great, the gameplay is great... you get the point. I had a lot of good experiences playing this game. Getting me and my Airboat out of bounds by accident in "Water Hazard." Being absolutely terrified in "We Don't Go To Ravenholm." (A few times because I was trying to get "Zombie Chopper," if you're going to get this achievement too, don't quit the game and do it in one sitting.) And having a lot of fun during the ending, [spoiler] using the op gravity gun [/spoiler]. One interesting moment happened after leaving Nova Prospekt and ending up in City 17. I joined up with several Resistance members, and at one point I look out the window and see two random people die in front of me. I started to tear up and actually feel bad for the two random NPC's I never saw before. If a game is able to make me feel bad for two random characters that don't even have names, it's a great game. After playing this game twice, once on normal and once on hard, this game absolutely deserves a 10/10, and I would definitely play it again.

Started playing this again due to the similarities between this and the State of Victoria, Australia.
Melbourne 2020 is City 17 in this. A city that has fallen to communism under the guise of something fake. I think city 17 isnt as bad as Melbourne as it at least faces a real threat alongside its communist regime.
This, along with the orange box is one of the best games of all time. And if theres ever a time to start playing, or have a second run through... Now is the time. The similarities to real life in the Orwelian environment that is city 17 is compelling. Just like Melbourne 2020.
ravenholm scared me don't buy it 0/10

Here i am playing the game for the 6th + time since 2004. i cant keep track of how many times ive beaten it. It really is that good of a game. Easily one of the best games ever made. This game had such a huge influence over the gaming industry and even spawned entire games ( Counter Strike, and Garrys Mod ) with huge player bases. This is one that everyone needs to try.  This is what single player fps should be like. It has many different elements that break up the gameplay and the plot is quite interesting and fun, especially if you pay close attention or also play the original Half Life. I promise you wont be disappointed in this game.
